title: Android 13 will help developers test their apps with slower internet connections
content:
It’s always important that Android apps work well on a wide variety of screen sizes, chipset types, mobile networks, and so on. Testing on slow network speeds is especially important, since not everyone has gigabit internet or unlimited 5G data connections, but it’s always been difficult to artificially throttle internet speeds on Android. The post Android 13 will help developers test their apps with slower internet connections appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Google is adding a feature to the upcoming Android 13 release that will allow app developers to simulate slower internet connections.
